data.title: It is not Chipotle
data.text: Notwithstanding the spate of food-borne illnesses reported at various Chipotle restaurants, I'd rather take the chance of contracting a bug than eating at Qdoba.  The food may appear similar, but the taste is not even close. Qdoba is a Jack & the Box property.  Need I say more?

data.title: tasty tex mex!
data.text: when my kids and i want something  more than a burger or sub, we head to qdoba! the tacos and mexican gumbo are our favorites. we also love the coke freestyle!

data.title: Ugh
data.text:
Went here with my sons and my husband last Saturday. The girl who served us had no idea what she was doing. She had to look at recipes for tacos and when she put the chicken on, she barely put any for any of us who wanted it and told my son it would be $2.00 more for extra when there was barely any. When one is buying three TINY tacos for 9.00, one really should have just gotten Taco Bell. It's no worse. My older son had gotten nachos and when we got them home, we found there were no nacho chips in the bag.
My younger son had gotten three chicken tacos and I got three vegetarian tacos and she threw them all in he bag together with no label and then proceeded to get sauce over the top of the bag which my husband had to get napkins for before he could pick it up. She couldn't be bothered. She was never friendly and seemed like she couldn't wait for us to be gone.
Needless to say, we won't be going back.

data.title: Great service
data.text: We visit this location at least twice a week. The staff is always nice and friendly. We had a mixup on our order this week and the manager stepped up to take care of us.

data.title: Chain mex
data.text: Chain restaurant with decent chain Mexican food'. Not much moe to say....okay but unexciting.. If one is on the road, it's more exciting than bk or Mickey d

data.title: Creative fast food but without the fast food taste.
data.text: Enjoy trying different combinations with different dishes for a unique experience all your own.  Adequate seating but try to avoid it during lunch rush.

data.title: Don't Go Here.
data.text: I just visited this location a little past 7:00 on Saturday.  There were only a few patrons and no wait.  The three employees were more interested in their trash talking that they were in serving me and my son.  They made us feel like we were imposing on them just to have our order made.  This alone would not prevent me from going again as I would assume there are more attentive and professional employees, but this location was disgusting.  The serving area had caked on dried up food and the floor was covered with broken chips and grease.  I like Qdoba and will definitely be back, but never to this location!

data.title: Very good place
data.text: The food was excellent. Location was convenient... Very good service also even though it was very busy.. It's a very popular place for lunch.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Food is expensive. Service is poor. Coupon deals are misleading. Counter person is not servicing good.,

data.title: fresh fast food
data.text: I love the freshness of the ingredients used and the choices on the menu.  The service is always fast and friendly.

data.title: good fast food, Tex Mex style
data.text:
This location is a clean and larger version of the popular chain.  It can get very busy at lunch -- consider placing your order on line before heading to the location.  Parking usually available within 40-50 feet of door, in a strip mall. 

Menu includes burritos, taco salads, quesadillas and tacos, which are prepared in front of you as you walk down the cafeteria-style line.  I recommend the steak; my husband likes the chicken.  Also consider the "pick two" lunch option: for a set price (6.99), you can order two items from among several, including quesadillas, soup, taco salad, tacos, etc.

The warmed Queso cheese sauce is amazing; a little pricey, but great for dipping chips into, or for slathering onto other dishes.  I'm not too keen on the selections for salsa: if you are fussy about salsa, ask for a taste if you are not familiar with their selections.

Also, if you frequent Qdoba locations, be sure to sign up for their Q card, which you present at every purcase -- I think you get a free entree for every$50 you buy -- enough that it is worth it.
